intro: Oenothera hookeri subsp. wolfii, commonly known as the desert evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its erect, branched stems and showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and produces capsule fruits containing numerous tiny seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Oenothera hookeri subsp. wolfii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh desert conditions.
